name: Thlaspi bursa pastoris

Head: Frequent epistaxis
Sharp pain over right eye drawing eye upwards
Vertigo; worse, rising
Tongue white, coated
Eyes and face puffy
Frontal pain; worse toward evening
Mouth and lips cracked
Scaly eruption behind ears
Urine: Often replaces the use of the catheter
Urethritis; urine runs away in little jets
Female: Leucorrhoea before and after menses; bloody, dark, offensive; STAINS INDELIBLY
Scarcely recovers from one period before another begins
SORE PAIN IN WOMB ON RISING
Metrorrhagia; too frequent and copious menses
Male: Spermatic cord sensitive to concussion of walking or riding

details: Is an anti-hemorrhagic and anti-uric acid remedy. Albuminuria during gestation. Chronic neuralgia. Renal and vesical irritation. Hemorrhage from uterine fibroid with aching in back or general bruised soreness. Aching between scapulae. Uterine hemorrhage, with cramps and expulsion of clots. Craves buttermilk. Effects of suppressed uterine disease. (Burnett.)
